mydb classes¶

class mydb.Comment(thread, user, body, parent=None)¶

Comments table

Relationships Tables
1:many user:comments
1:many thread:comments
Parameters:
  • user (User) – The user that created this comment
  • thread (Thread) – The thread this comment lives in
  • parent (Comment) – If this comment is a reply, this is set to the parent comment. Otherwise, None
  • body (str) – The body text of the comment
class mydb.Image(imagename, geoloc=None)¶

Image Table

Relationships Tables
1:1 thread:image
many:1 tags:image
Parameters:
  • imagename (str) – The name of the image, stored on disk
  • geoloc (str) – The X,Y coordinates for Google maps. May be null
  • tags (Tag) – list of children tag objects
class mydb.Tag(image, name)¶

Tag table

Relationships Tables
many:1 tags:image
Parameters:
  • image (Image) – The image this tag is associated with
  • name (str) – The text of this tag
class mydb.Thread(title, body, user, image)¶

Thread Table

Relationships Tables
many:1 user:thread
1:many thread:comments
1:1 thread:image
Parameters:
  • id (int) – unique id
  • title (str) – thread title
  • body (str) – OP’s body text
  • user (User) – parent user object (1:many thread:user)
  • image (Image) – image object (1:1 image:thread)
  • comments (Comment) – list of children comment objects (1:many thrad: comments)
class mydb.User(username, password, role)¶

User Table

Relationships Tables
1:many user:thread
1:many user:comments
Parameters:
  • username (str) – User’s username
  • password (str) – User’s hashed + salted password
  • role (str) – User’s role [‘user’, ‘admin’]
  • comments (Comment) – list of comments the user has made
  • thread (Thread) – list of threads the user has made
mydb.addtags(imagename, taglist)¶

Appends tags to the given image

Parameters:
  • imagename (str) – name of image stored on disk
  • taglist ([Tag]) – list of tags to be appended
Returns:

Nothing
mydb.dumpdb()¶

retores the database, returns text to give back to the user

mydb.getgeoloc(filepath)¶

Finds the geolocation for the given file, by reading the EXIF data. Only useful for jpg files.

Parameters:filepath (str) – full filepath for the target image
Returns:geolocation (str) if found
Returns:None otherwise
mydb.getids()¶

Returns a list of (backup_ids, full_text)

mydb.makeall()¶

Autogenerates dummy data

mydb.makeall_real()¶

Autogenerates dummy data based on reddit threads

mydb.newcomment(threadobj, user, body, parent=None)¶

Commits a new comment

Parameters:
  • threadobj (Thread) – the thread owning this comment
  • user (User) – the user posting this comment
  • body (str) – the body text
  • parent (Comment) – the comment this comment replies to, if relevant. Otherwise, None
Returns:

the Comment object
mydb.newthread(title, body, imagename, userobj, tags, geoloc=None)¶

adds a new thread to the DB and commits

Parameters:
  • title (str) – title of the thread
  • body (str) – body text for the OP
  • imagename (str) – name of the image stored on disk
  • userobj (User) – the user making the thread
  • tags (Tag) – list of tags associated with the image
  • geoloc (str) – geoloc for the image, if available. Otherwise None
Returns:

(Thread, Image) tuple. The Thread and Image objects created.
mydb.newuser(username, password, role)¶

Adds a new user :param str username: :param str password: plaintext password :param str role: user’s role from [‘user’, ‘admin’]

Returns:-1 if username was taken
Returns:Otherwise, the User object.
mydb.restoredb(num)¶

restores the database; returns text to give back to the user

mydb.with_slave(fn)¶

Decorator

Forces the decorated function to use the slave session, instead of the master.

Returns the session to the master at the end of the function.
